meanings.sent1: The recipe was reducible to just a few key ingredients.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle was so complex, it was not easily reducible to a simple solution.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed reducible in size, yet he kept pulling out more and more rabbits!
meanings.sent4: Her stress felt like a heavy weight, slowly becoming more reducible as she practiced mindfulness.
meanings.sent5: The concept of gravity became more reducible to the students after the hands-on experiment.

meanings.definition: Able to be simplified or made smaller.
meanings.sent1: The instructions were clear and reducible for even the youngest students to understand.
meanings.sent2: The budget was tight, so expenses had to be reducible without sacrificing quality.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations were so over-the-top that making them reducible was a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: His excitement was like a balloon, easily reducible with a simple pinprick of disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The story started complex but became more reducible as the plot unfolded.
